page.title: 11OLD LADY ON VILOENCE & WAR
page.content: I interviewed a 76 year old war widow who lived in a rest home in Birkdale. She survived the horrors of both world wars and has seen many changes in the standards and attitudes of our society Despite the high unemployment and rising prices of today she believed that the majority of people complain too much;life when she was young had been much harder due to the 1930's depression.She thought that the Government had got its priorities wrong,that they spent too much time and money on nuclear weapons and not enough on reducing unemployment.She said that a war of nuclear powers could never happen because that would reduce the second world war to a pillow fight.She thought that violence had been with us since the 1930's but todays improved communications made everybody more aware of the problem.
